sect2.title: Introduction to JOE
sect2.para: JOE (Joe's own editor) is a small text editor capable of emulating WordStar, Pico, and Emacs.

sect2.title: Installation of JOE
sect2.para: Install JOE by running the following commands:

sect2.title: Configuration files
sect2.para: JOE can make use of several configuration files. Information about these files may be found in the joe man page. These files are /etc/jmacsrc, /etc/joerc, /etc/jpicorc, /etc/jstarrc, and /etc/rjoerc. JOE can also make use of ~/.joerc, which may be copied from /etc/joerc and customized for each user's taste.

sect2.title: Contents
sect2.para: The JOE package contains jmacs, joe, jpico, jstar, rjoe and termidx.

sect3.title: jmacs
sect3.para: jmacs is a symbolic link to joe used to launch Emacs emulation mode.

sect3.title: joe
sect3.para: joe is a small text editor capable of emulating WordStar, Pico, and Emacs.

sect3.title: jpico
sect3.para: jpico is a symbolic link to joe used to launch Pico emulation mode.

sect3.title: jstar
sect3.para: jstar is a symbolic link to joe used to launch WordStar emulation mode.

sect3.title: rjoe
sect3.para: rjoe is a symbolic link to joe that restricts JOE to editing only files which are specified on the command-line.

sect3.title: termidx
sect3.para: termidx is a program used by joe to generate the termcap index file.
